lessons.title: Heard that Bird?
lessons.preface: Interactive presentation, asking students to follow along with scientists and identify bird sounds in pop culture.

lesson.lsnPreface: Interactive presentation, asking students to follow along with scientists and identify bird sounds in pop culture.
learningObj: Students will analyze spectrograms to visualize and differentiate sounds.
Students will mirror the process of real scientists to identify bird species.
Students will analyze bird sounds in popular culture to foster curiousity of birds in their daily lives.

lsnPrep.prepQuickDescription:
Print handouts. 
Check slideshow audio/video.
Determine team format for gameshow.
lsnPrep.prepDetails:
The gameshow relies on many videos embedded into the slide deck. Make sure that your projector can amplify the video and sound appropriately.
Additionally, you might want to think about how students will work in teams during the gameshow.

steps.StepQuickDescription: Students will listen to two different bird sounds and think about what words or feelings come up.
During the initial practice round, students will learn the format of the gameshow and be introduced to sound spectrograms.
steps.Vocab: - **Sound spectrogram:**  a visual representation of frequencies in a recording over time

steps.StepQuickDescription: During the game, students can keep track of their scores in the Heard that Bird worksheet and play alongside bird song researchers at Vanderbilt University!
Students will reflect on the game by completing the exit ticket questions on their worksheet.
steps.TeachingTips: Students can further test their bird song skills by exploring Cornell University's Bird Song Hero!

lsnExt.itemDescription: This game will further test students' spectrogram skills in identifying bird songs!

lsnExt.itemTitle: Article: The link between birdsong and language
lsnExt.itemDescription: What can birds teach us about human connection? This article gives us a look into how bird scientists can help us make better sense of linguistics and human culture
Record birds live and ID them based on their songs

lsnExt.itemTitle: The Anatomy of Bird Song Presentation
lsnExt.itemDescription: Dive into the anatomy of bird song with these free slides

lsnExt.itemTitle: The Joys and Challenges of Birding While Black: Video by PBS
lsnExt.itemDescription: Bird watching is for everyone, but systemic racism in the US means that not everyone has the same experience birding. Learn more about the different experience of birders, and help your students consider ways to make birding more accessible to everyone!

lsnExt.itemTitle: Article: How LA's bird population is shaped by historic redlining and racist loan practices
lsnExt.itemDescription: Provide your students with a case study to explore how historical and social factors impact bird populations today. Redlined areas have less data samples of birds.Encourage your students to collect data and support a science in urban areas. We need more citizen scientists producing data in our communities!

lsnExt.itemDescription: Explore the exciting connections between bird sounds, music, and human emotion
